properties.areaDesc: Adams, PA; Cumberland, PA; Franklin, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 7:31AM EST until January 8 at 8:15AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Central Adams County in south central Pennsylvania...
Central Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania...
Southwestern Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania...

* Until 815 AM EST.

* At 731 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Scotland,
moving east at 50 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes Interstate 81 from mile markers 11 to 27. This
squall will take up to a half of an hour to move away from I-81.

Locations impacted include...
Chambersburg, Gettysburg, Shippensburg, Hampton, Guilford, St.
Thomas, Fayetteville, Lake Meade, Bonneauville, Scotland, Lake
Heritage, Fort Loudon, Cashtown, Aspers, Orrtanna, Pine Grove
Furnace, Biglerville, Arendtsville, York Springs and Heidlersburg.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 8:15 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
